title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When the user shuts down Windows while a WSWB session is open with a dirty .txt file, the changes in the .txt file are lost without any warning or savefile prompt. This behavior is not consistent with other Windows programs like Word and Outlook.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with a dirty .txt file and the user shuts down Windows using the Start menu command 'Shut Down', the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately without any warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s).
EB: When a WSWB session is open with a dirty .txt file and the user shuts down Windows using the Start menu command 'Shut Down', a warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected Behavior:
A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
